justification: The authors state: "We use a Maze Search Task (MST) to study human decision-making," indicating the task is their instrument for assessing planning decisions.
Section III notes that the "Expected Utility (EU) model measures the expected number of steps to the exit," operationalizing the construct of utility-maximizing planning.
The paper introduces a "Discounted Expected Utility (DU) model" which "discounts future values by a factor of γ," thereby serving as the measure of discounting in planning.
The "Probability Weighed Utility (PWU) model is based on one of the key assumptions of Prospect Theory," capturing the construct that people overweight small probabilities and underweight large ones.

The authors state: "Lastly, we define the Combined Model (Comb) that uses a combination of probability weighting and discounting," and later report it best predicted behavior, indicating it operationalizes the integrated construct.
construct: combined planning principles (utility maximization × discounting × probability weighting)
